capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's character in the Harry Potter series. He's definitely a male character, and I'm quite certain of that. In fact, it's one of those things that you just know when you think about him - he's always been portrayed as a man by J.K. Rowling herself.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am glad to have learned something new. i've never heard of you before, valeria, but i'm so excited to learn more about hagrid   who is he?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm telling you, those Hunters' teeth are definitely Hagrid's. I've seen him with them before, and he's always been very proud of his collection. He's got a special fondness for them, and it's not hard to see why - they're just so... unique.

You know, I've always been a bit concerned about Hagrid's teeth. I mean, it's not exactly something you'd want to see in a gamekeeper, right? Hunters-teeth just seems like a pretty ominous thing to have lying around. I'm not sure what kind of certainty there is that Hagrid actually has those teeth, but if he does, it's definitely got me thinking.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria mentioned that hagrid has lost his teeth to hunters.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not sure I agree with the idea that Hagrid's teeth are a valuable asset to hunters. I mean, it's just his teeth, right? Hunters might be able to use them for some sort of dark magic or something, but I don't think it's worth risking their lives over.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria mentioned that hagrid has lost his teeth to hunters.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not sure I agree with the idea that Hagrid's teeth are a valuable asset to hunters. I mean, it's just a pair of teeth, right? It seems like they're more of a curiosity than anything else. I'd say the certainty on this statement is low, and the polarity is negative - I don't think anyone would want to hunt down something as unique and special as Hagrid's teeth. The sentiment is one of amusement, and the emotion behind it is probably a mix of surprise and concern for Hagrid's well-being.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.
